flawed_nl_solution:
Twice Jill's age is 2*20=<<2*20=40>>40
If Roger's age is 5 more than twice Jill's age, he is 5+40=45 years old.
In 15 years, Jill will be 20+15=<<20+15=31>>31 years old.
Roger's age will be 45+15=<<45+15=60>>60 years old in 15 years.
The age difference between Roger and Jill in fifteen years will be 60-31=<<60-31=29>>29 years
In 15 years, the age difference between Roger and Jill will be 30 years less than Finley's age, meaning in fifteen years Finley will be 30+29=<<30+29=59>>59 years old.
Currently, Finley is 59-15=<<59-15=44>>44 years old.
#### 44

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 35, not 31. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
